trans-unit.source:
References

https://online.fiiw.pl/courses/pelny-portfel/

https://www.et-foundation.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/ETF001_SafeSpace_2021.pdf

https://www.class.com/blog/creating-safe-and-supportive-virtual-classrooms-best-practices-for-k-12-educators/

https://www.researchgate.net/publication/373238572_Strategies_for_Designing_Inclusive_Online_Learning_Environment

https://information-services.ed.ac.uk/help-consultancy/is-skills/digital-safety-wellbeing-and-citizenship/staying-safe-learning-teaching-online

 


Glossary

5-Minute Engagement Toolkit - A set of short, high-energy activities (e.g., polls, quick chats) injected frequently to break passivity and check learners' attention levels.

Agency - The learner's feeling of control and power over their own learning, choices, and actions within the course.

Bandwidth - The amount of data that can be sent over an internet connection; low bandwidth causes poor audio/video quality and disconnection.

Digital Literacy Gap - The difference in skills and knowledge needed to use digital tools effectively between the educator and the learner (often high for this group).

Equitable Participation - Structuring activities (like Round-Robin) to ensure that every learner, especially hesitant or quiet ones, gets an equal chance to contribute.

Hybrid Learning - An instructional method that simultaneously teaches a group of learners who are physically present and a group who are attending remotely online.

Learner-Centred Approach - Focusing the teaching and course design entirely on the individual needs, goals, and context of the student.

Mandatory Reporting - The legal or ethical requirement to report disclosures of harm, abuse, or serious risk to designated authorities or safeguarding officers.

Psychological Safety - A shared belief that the online space is safe for taking interpersonal risks, like asking a question or admitting a mistake, without fear of fear of judgment.

Respectful Confrontation - Addressing an unacceptable behavior (like multitasking) immediately and specifically, while using neutral language to preserve the learner's dignity.

Round Protocol - A strategy where the educator goes around the group sequentially, asking each person to contribute, to guarantee every voice is heard.

Safeguarding - The formal, institutional process and policies put in place to protect vulnerable people from harm, abuse, or neglect.

Trauma-Informed Approach Teaching - and communication methods that recognize and respond to the effects of trauma without causing further distress.

Educators Integrity - The trainer's consistent commitment to being honest, reliable, and ethically responsible to the learners and the organization.

Training Contract - A set of clear, agreed-upon rules and expectations for behavior created collaboratively by the trainer and the learners.
